top_categories.workout_context: 53ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
75 miles on flanders rolling gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Flanders Legacy Gravel's Flanders rolling, Belgian gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 75 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Flanders Legacy Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Flanders Legacy Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
At Flanders Legacy Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
When someone attacks on flanders rolling gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Base fitness for Flanders Legacy Gravel. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Flanders Legacy Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
The aerobic base that lets you ride flanders rolling gravel at tempo for 75 miles without cracking. No shortcuts.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 4,000ft of climbing on flanders rolling gravel does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Flanders Legacy Gravel’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Flanders Legacy Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on flanders rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: flanders rolling, belgian gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Durability, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 75 miles of flanders rolling gravel in Flanders, Belgium.
